dublin_core.dcvalue: In developed countries chronic disease now accounts for more than 75 of health care expenditure and nearly an equivalent percentage of disease related deaths 1 The burden of chronic disease often but not exclusively associated with ageing includes congestive heart failure CHF chronic obstructive pulmonary disease COPD hypertension and diabetes Over the past several decades there has been an epidemiological shift in disease burden from acute to chronic diseases that has rendered acute care models of health service delivery inadequate to address population health needs
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-12T11:29:48Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2010-11-24
Conference proceedings : ... Annual International Conference of the IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society. IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society. Annual Conference
Telehealth technologies for managing chronic disease - experiences from Australia and the UK.
